context_bundle.summary: Analyzing Git merge conflicts before attempting merge

onboarding.quick_start: Always analyze conflicts before merging diverged branches
common_patterns: git merge-base main branch (find common ancestor)
git diff merge-base..main -- file (changes in main)
git diff merge-base..branch -- file (changes in branch)
git log --oneline merge-base..main -- file (commits touching file in main)
git log --oneline merge-base..branch -- file (commits touching file in branch)

conflict_indicators.same_file_both_branches: HIGH conflict risk - both modified same file
conflict_indicators.same_filename_different_content: CRITICAL - file recreated with different purpose

resolution_strategies.keep_main: When main has evolved significantly (e.g., v1.0 -> v1.2)
resolution_strategies.keep_branch: When branch has unique content not in main
resolution_strategies.merge_manually: When both have valuable changes to combine
resolution_strategies.cherry_pick: When only specific files from branch are needed

real_example.scenario: Branch has install.ps1 v1.0.0, main has v1.2.1
real_example.analysis: Main evolved through 6 commits, branch is stale
real_example.resolution: Keep main's install.ps1, cherry-pick only .claude/ configs
